meanings.definition: To remove or reduce the pressure from a confined space.
meanings.sent1: The astronaut carefully depressurized the airlock before exiting into space.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic had to depressurize the tire before fixing the puncture.
meanings.sent3: After the party, they depressurized the balloon by letting the air out slowly.
meanings.sent4: The teacher helped the students depressurize their minds before the exam.
meanings.sent5: The scuba diver knew he had to depressurize slowly to avoid getting the bends.

meanings.sent1: The depressurized cabin made it easier to open the airplane door.
meanings.sent2: The room felt cool and comfortable with its depressurized atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The depressurized soda can made a funny noise when opened.
meanings.sent4: The depressurized tire looked slightly deflated but was still usable.
meanings.sent5: The depressurized container collapsed slightly under the reduced pressure.
